alert.note: Alert for Clinton (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 02 at 2:13AM EDT until July 02 at 5:15AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR WEST CENTRAL CLINTON COUNTY... At 213 AM EDT, emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area with water covering Route 374 in multiple locations as well as some washouts on secondary roads. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Merrill and Ellenburg Mountain including the following roads: Route 374 from Chazy Lake through Merrill, Peets Road, and Bradley Pond Road. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads which are difficult to see at nighttime. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
